title.narrative: Mitigating the impact of El Niño in Darfur & Emergency Assistance Floods in Kassala State

description.narrative: Target area of the El Niño response covers substantial parts of West Darfur (Sirba, Geneina, Jebel Moon and Kereinik localities) and South Darfur (Alwehda, Mershing and Bielel localities). The total estimated number of beneficiaries is about 42,000. Please note that these target groups are for the overal programme, not ZOA only. Target area of the Kassala flood response are Hameshkoreib, North Delta, Telkuk, Rural Aroma, Rural Khasm Al Girba and Rural River Atbara localities in Kassala State. The total targeted population is 22,381 people. Please note that this is the target group of this intervention which is implemented by Plan International Sudan and Practical Action.

The strong El Niño event of 2015-6 has substantially disturbed rainfall patterns in large parts of Sudan and surrounding countries. In response to this situation, members of the Aqua4Darfur Partnership (ZOA, IAS, Practical Action and SOS Sahel) propose to intervene with the objective of mitigating the effects of the 2015 El Niño phenomenon, and contributing to post-drought recovery of cultivation and grazing lands. Flooding and heavy rains in Kassala state caused substantial damage in the area. Plan International Sudan and Practical Action will focus on addressing the life-saving needs of vulnerable affected people through a 6 month holistic WASH intervention

Under the proposed El Niño response, the following activities are proposed: 1) Renovation of non-functioning water points in drought-affected areas / 2) Reseeding of drought-affected pastures / 3) Distribution of seeds and key inputs to subsistence farmers / 4) Provision of shelter for South Sudanese who fled to East Darfur. Under the Kassala floods response, the following results will be achieved: 1) Increased access to safe drinking water for the affected people / 2) Affected people have improved ability to observe adequate sanitation and hygiene practices / 3) Affected households have access to shelter and other key infrastructure / 4) Strengthened community resilience through building capacity of the affected communities in Disaster Risk Preparedness & response and prevention measures to floods.

participating-org.narrative: International Aid Services (IAS) - only El Niño response
Plan International Sudan - only Kassala floods response
Practical Action - El Niño and Kassala Floods responses
SOS Sahel - only El Niño response

description.narrative: Sirba, Geneina, Jebel Moon and Kereinik localities
Hameshkoreib, North Delta, Telkuk, Rural Aroma, Rural Khasm Al Girba and Rural River Atbara localities
